H0.text: Who was the first leader of the Russian Federation . Mikhail Gorbachev

H1.text: Who was the first leader of the Russian Federation . Alexander Rutskoy

H2.text: Who was the first leader of the Russian Federation . Nikolai Ryzhkov

H3.text: Who was the first leader of the Russian Federation . Yelcin

A4.text: Alexander Vladimirovich Rutskoy (Russian: Александр Владимирович Руцкой; born 16 September 1947) is a Russian politician and former Soviet military officer who served as the only vice president of Russia from 1991 to 1993.

A5.text: He was proclaimed acting president following Boris Yeltsin's impeachment during the 1993 Russian constitutional crisis.

A6.text: In 1991, Boris Yeltsin was elected president of the RSFSR, becoming the first non-Communist Party member to be elected into a major Soviet political role.

A7.text: Yeltsin was elected president of the Russian SFSR with 57% of the vote, becoming the first popularly elected president.
